adjective.description: Of, relating to, or belonging to the ancient Greek school of philosophy and logic founded 400 b.c. by Euclides of Megara.

noun.description: A philosopher of the Megaric school.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Stanley (1625–1678), poet and classical scholar. From ancient Greek Μεγαρικός belonging to Megara, philosopher of the Megarian school from Μέγαρα + -ικός. Compare classical Latin Megaricus, adjective and noun.
